mdl.eyelink.calibration¶

Created on Wed Feb 13 15:37:43 2019
@author: Semeon Risom
@email: semeon.risom@gmail.com.
This allows mdl.eyetracking package to initiate calibration/validation/drift correction.
class mdl.eyelink.calibration.calibration(w, h, tracker, window)[source]¶

This allows mdl.eyetracking package to initiate calibration/validation/drift correction.

Methods

alert_printf(self, msg) Print error messages.
draw_image_line(self, width, line, totlines, …) Display image pixel by pixel, line by line.
draw_line(self, x1, y1, x2, y2, colorindex) Draw a line.
erase_cal_target(self) Erase the calibration/validation target.
exit_image_display(self) Clear the camera image.
getColorFromIndex(self, colorindex) Return psychopy colors for elements in the camera image.
get_input_key(self) This function will be constantly pools, update the stimuli here is you need dynamic calibration target.
get_mouse_state(self) Get the current mouse position and status
play_beep(self, beepid) Play a sound during calibration/drift correction.
set_image_palette(self, r, g, b) Given a set of RGB colors, create a list of 24bit numbers representing the pallet.
setup_image_display(self, width, height) Set up the camera image, for newer APIs, the size is 384 x 320 pixels.

Screen width, height.

play_beep(self, beepid)[source]¶

Play a sound during calibration/drift correction.

record_abort_hide(self)[source]¶
set_image_palette(self, r, g, b)[source]¶

Given a set of RGB colors, create a list of 24bit numbers representing the pallet. I.e., RGB of (1,64,127) would be saved as 82047, or the number 00000001 01000000 011111111

setup_cal_display(self)[source]¶
setup_image_display(self, width, height)[source]¶

Set up the camera image, for newer APIs, the size is 384 x 320 pixels.
